doc.field: This volume opens with the marriage (1943) of Benjamin, Jr. to Bertha Maier. It continues to trace Adele's career, including becoming a children's wear buyer for Julius Gutman & Co. and moving to Baltimore to work at The Hub. Documents indicate that she was active in the Infant's and Children's Wear Buyers' Association, and these include an unattributed article written by her in the association's magazine in support of the need for buyers. Tickets, a songbook, snapshots from a Shibe Park rally, and a reception invitation suggest she was a Henry A. Wallace supporter in 1948, and that she may have attended a dinner and reception with Wallace and Paul Robeson. There are travel photos and souvenirs from Quebec, Ausable Chasm, and other places in upper New York State and the surrounding area. Finally, there is documentation from the University of California at Berkeley where Buchalter briefly matriculated to earn a B.A. in 1952 (degree certificate in scrapbook).
